displayed_text: The National Institute of Anthropology and History said Monday that a team led by archaeologist Leonardo Lopez Lujan had discovered an 8.4-meter-long -LRB- 27-foot-long -RRB- tunnel leading into the center of a circular platform where dead rulers were believed to have been cremated .
summary_1: The National Institute of Anthropology and History is a Mexican government department that researches Mexican history . They announced recently that a team had discovered a 27-foot-long -LRB- 8.4-meter -RRB- tunnel . The team was led by archaeologist Leonardo Lopez Lujan . The tunnel leads into the center of a circular platform . Dead rulers were believed to have been cremated at the site .
summary_2: The National Institute of Anthropology and History said Monday that a team led by archaeologist Leonardo Lopez Lujan had discovered an 8.4-meter-long -LRB- 27-foot-long -RRB- tunnel leading into the center of a circular platform where dead rulers were believed to have been cremated.
summary_3: The National Institute of Anthropology and History said Monday that a team led by archaeologist Leonardo Lopez Lujan had discovered an 8.4-meter-long 27-foot-long tunnel leading into the center of a circular platform where dead rulers were believed to have been cremated.
summary_4: Archaeologist Leonardo Lopez Lujan's team found a 27-foot-long tunnel leading to a circular platform where dead rulers were cremated, according to the National Institute of Anthropology and History.
